abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.help: ABSTRACT: The proposal abstract should clearly communicate the proposal’s objectives, relevance, expected outcomes, and potential impact, serving as a high-level overview of the proposal's essential points. It should include key elements such as the research question, background context, hypothesis, methodology, and anticipated results. The abstract should be succinct yet detailed enough to convey the essence of the proposal, highlighting its innovation and relevance to the field. The text should be a maximum of 250 words.

addProposal.label: Add Proposal
addProposal.toolTip: Click to add a new proposal.
addProposal.warning: Please wait whilst we create a new proposal

addTarget.label: Add Target
addTarget.toolTip: Will add the target to the list associated with the proposal

arrayConfiguration.label: Array Configuration
arrayConfiguration.help: Specify an array a configuration. Currently the SKA has two arrays - SKA-MID (350MHz - 154GHz) and SKA-LOW (50MHz – 350 MHz).

bandWidth.help: The bandwidth in MHz (LOW) or GHz (MID). Must be fully contained within the selected band. Note that for the AA0.5, AA1 and AA2 configurations, the specified bandwidth cannot exceed 800 MHz.
bandWidth.label: Band Width

centralFrequency.help: The central frequency of the observation. Must be within the selected band.
centralFrequency.label: Central Frequency

range.lowError: Please enter a number between 50 and 350

changeProposal.label: Change Proposal's type?
changeProposal.content1: You are about to change the type of your proposal.
changeProposal.content2: Some data specific to the proposal type may be lost.

clearBtn.label: Clear
clearBtn.toolTip: This will clear the file upload selection

continuumBandWidth.help: Select or enter the desired bandwidth in MHz (LOW) or GHz (MID). You can also specify a custom bandwidth by selecting the custom option.
continuumBandWidth.label: Continuum BandWidth

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

deleteTarget.label: Delete this target ?
deleteTarget.content1: NOTE : Selections to the observations will also be removed

deleteObservation.label: Delete this observation ?
deleteObservation.content1: NOTE : Links to the targets will also be removed

displayProposal.warning: Please wait whilst we load the selected proposal

elevation.help: The user can use this field to specify the elevation at which the target will be observed. The default elevation is 45 deg. The minimum elevation is 15 deg for the LOW and MID telescopes and the maximum elevation is the target’s zenith elevation.
elevation.label: Minimum Elevation

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

email.label: Email
email.help: The email is a required field and must be provided. The investigator will be invited to participate in this proposal using this email so please ensure it is correct.

pdfDownload.error: Not able to Get PDF Download URL

science.label: Science Justification
science.toolTip: This is the download button of the file on the Science Page

technical.label: Technical Justification
technical.toolTip: This is the download button of the file on the Technical Page

firstName.label: First Name
firstName.help: Requires the first name of the investigators.

groupObservations.label: Group
groupObservations.help: Add observations to a group using the add button.
groupObservations.toolTip: Add observations to a group using the add button.

imageSize.label: Image Size
imageSize.help: Specify the image size based on the selected data product(s) in arcseconds, arcminutes or degrees.

lastName.label: Last Name
lastName.help: Last name or family name of the investigator.

listOfTargets.label: List of Targets
listOfTargets.toolTip: A list of target will be entered and/or imported from file.

name.label: Name
name.help: Name of the target/object. If you want to automatically populate the coordinates then provide a name of a known object and hit the resolve button to query SIMBAD first and NED if not found. However, you can provide an arbitrary target/object name which can contain any character and enter the coordinate values.

observingBand.help: Select the observing band, noting that the array will be automaticsally populated based on band.
observingBand.label: Observing Band

dp.label: Observation
dp.help: Select the observation set for which you want to request a data product(s).

observationType.label: Observation Type
observationType.help: Specify if the observation type is continuum or zoom. Note that not all sub-arrays have zoom mode so this option is available based on the sub-array chosen.

observatoryDataProduct.label: Observatory Data Product
observatoryDataProduct.help: Select the desired data product. You can select multiple by checking the appropriate boxes.

observationDetails.help: Provide any further details about specific targets or any other considerations about observation(s).
observationDetails.label: Details

pdfPreview.label: PDF Preview
pdfPreview.science: This is the PDF preview button on the Science page

proposals.empty: THERE ARE NO PROPOSALS TO BE DISPLAYED

proposalType.label: Proposal Types
proposalType.help1: A description of the different types is provided on 'hover' as an aid as to the correct type of proposal to be selected
proposalType.help3: It is possible to change proposal type at a later date, however be aware that this may cause information already entered to be lost

members.label: Team Members
members.empty: THERE ARE NO TEAM MEMBERS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROPOSAL

noSpecificTarget.label: No Specific Target
noSpecificTarget.toolTip: Current functionality is not yet available

error.mapping: Unable to map results from API
error.name: Unable to resolve provided name

rightAscension.help: Right ascension HELP: RA can be in hours, minutes, and seconds, where 24 hours represents a full 360-degree rotation. For example, '+33:55:00.00'.  RA can also be in degrees in which case you have to select the appropriate unit.
rightAscension.label: Right ascension

scienceCategory.label: Science Category
scienceCategory.help: Select a category that best describes the science of your proposal.

scienceSubCategory.label: Scientific sub-category
scienceSubCategory.help: SUB-CATEGORY: Select a sub-category that best describes your proposal.

1.value: Right Ascension: RA can be in hours, minutes, and seconds, where 24 hours represents a full 360-degree rotation. For example, '+33:55:00.00'.  RA can also be in degrees in which case you have to select the appropriate unit.

2.value: DECLINATION: This field takes the declination of a target in a string format 'DD:MM:SS.S' or in degrees. Declinations below 5 degrees cannot be observed for MID observations and below 10 degrees for LOW observations.

sensitivityCalculatorResults.title: Sensitivity Calculator Results
sensitivityCalculatorResults.errorUnknown: The error is undetermined at this time

specialCharacters.invalid: Invalid input: only alphanumeric characters, spaces, and some special characters are allowed
specialCharacters.email: Please enter a valid email address.

spectralAveraging.help: The factor by which the intrinsic spectral resolution (13.44 kHz) should be averaged. The averaging factor can be set to 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12 or 24. The Effective resolution field displays the channel width after applying the spectral averaging.
spectralAveraging.label: Spectral Averaging

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

spectralResolution.help: High spectral resolution allows you to Identify and separate closely spaced spectral lines, Analyze fine details in the composition, temperature, and velocity of your targets/objects, Detect subtle shifts in wavelength due to Doppler effects or chemical composition changes.
spectralResolution.label: Spectral Resolution

subBands.help: Number of sub-bands to split the bandwidth up into, which can be set to 1-32. The default number of sub-bands is 1. If the number of sub-bands is greater than 1, the minimum and maximum weighted sensitivity per sub-band, confusion noise per sub-band, total sensitivity per sub-band, synthesised beam size per sub-band and surface-brightness sensitivity per sub-band, are reported.
subBands.label: Number of sub bands

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

suppliedType.help: The sensitivity for the observation in units of Jy/beam or K. This is used to calculate the integration time needed to reach this sensitivity. The integration time of the observation. This is used to calculate the sensitivity that will be reached with this integration time. Units are selectable in the calculator.

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

tapering.help: A circular Gaussian taper may be applied to the uv data. It specifies the FWHM of an image-domain Gaussian, in arcsec; tapering the uv data is equivalent to convolving with this image-domain Gaussian.
tapering.label: Tapering

targetMosaic.label: Target Mosaic
targetMosaic.toolTip: Current functionality is not yet available

targets.label: Targets
targets.empty: THERE IS NO TARGET ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROPOSAL

title.label: Proposal Title
title.helper: Please enter your title information. This field supports latex syntax.

uploadCsvBtn.label: Upload CSV File
uploadCsvBtn.uploadSuccessMsg: All targets in file are uploaded
uploadCsvBtn.uploadErrorPartialMsg: Partially uploaded - some rows contain empty values which will be omitted

velocity.label: Velocity
velocity.help: Specify the radial velocity if needed but this field is optional. Using the resolve button will auto-populate this field if value is in SIMBAD.

weather.help: This is the allowed level of Precipitable Water Vapour
weather.label: Weather

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

weighting.label: Weighting
weighting.help: The calculator offers natural, uniform or Briggs weighting. For Briggs weighting, the robustness parameter can be set to -2 (closest to uniform weighting), -1, 0, 1 or 2 (closest to natural weighting).

1.title: Team
1.desc: Principal investigators should ensure Co-investigators are registered through the SKAO portal. Co-investigators with pending status will be removed from the proposal during validation.

3.title: Science
3.desc: Upload a Science justification for this proposal in a portable document format (pdf).

4.title: Target
4.desc: Select a category to associate target(s) with this proposal. For a list of targets you can only specify a maximum of 30.

6.title: Technical
6.desc: Upload a Science justification for this proposal in a portable document format (pdf).

7.noProducts: THERE ARE NO DATA PRODUCTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROPOSAL
7.title: SDP Data

9.desc: Provide a title of your proposal.

13.title: Data Product
13.desc: Add data product(s) to your observation set(s). You can request more than one data products for an observation set.
